main event: A balloon-like object crashed over a mountain after the wind died down suddenly.
interesting points: The object was approximately 50 feet long and 20 feet in diameter, with a cellophane envelope that just exploded upon crashing.
The wreckage was gathered by a forest ranger after the crash.
The object was observed at an altitude of 15,000 feet by a civilian assistant chief observer with the Ground Observer Corps in Portland, Oregon.
The object appeared to have a transparent white to silvery disc shape, approximately 30 feet in diameter, and had an exhaust-type propulsion system.

After the object circled overhead, it fell out of the balloon, and there appeared to be an explosion with small streaks of vapor trails. Four parachutes were then observed falling on the south side of Mount Adams.
sighted object: Balloon-like object, transparent white to silvery disc shape, approximately 30 feet in diameter
witnesses: Civilian assistant chief observer with the Ground Observer Corps in Portland, Oregon
photographs: No photographs included in the report
